agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Intergovernmental Relations TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Tuesday, April 23, 2019 PLACE: E1.016 (Hearing Room) CHAIR: Senator Eddie Lucio, Jr. The Senate Committee on Intergovernmental Relations will meet to consider the following: SB 545 Watson Relating to the evaluation of applications for certain financial assistance administered by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs. SB 958 Johnson Relating to a right of first refusal applicable to the sale of housing developments that have received certain financial assistance administered by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs. SB 1024 Perry | et al. Relating to access to services in an area annexed by a tier 1 municipality under a service plan. SB 1118 Lucio Relating to programs operated by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs to increase access to safe and affordable housing in this state. SB 1468 Campbell Relating to annexation by certain municipalities of a special district under a strategic partnership agreement. SB 1870 Hinojosa Relating to municipal annexation. SB 2002 Alvarado Relating to the inclusion of affordable housing as a qualifying project for public-private partnerships. SB 2005 Lucio Relating to authorizing certain border counties and municipalities in those counties to address population growth and prevent the proliferation of substandard dwellings; creating a criminal offense; authorizing a fee. SB 2318 Campbell Relating to the authority of a county to require a person to obtain a building permit from the county for certain portable structures. SB 2357 Lucio Relating to issues affecting counties and other political subdivisions of the state. SB 2445 West Relating to the creation of the New Park Municipal Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. SB 2446 West Relating to the creation of the SoGood Cedars Municipal Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. SB 2518 Alvarado Relating to the creation of the East Houston Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, or taxes. SB 2520 Bettencourt Relating to the powers and duties of the Cy-Champ Public Utility District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose a tax. SB 2530 Fallon Relating to the creation of the Van Alstyne Municipal Utility District No. 2 of Collin County; granting a limited power of eminent domain; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. SB 2535 Fallon Relating to the powers and duties of the Lakehaven Municipal Utility District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose a tax. The Committee may also consider pending business. For members of the public who wish to provide oral testimony, please limit prepared remarks to two (2) minutes. If providing written testimony, please submit twenty (20) copies, with your name on each copy, to the Committee during the hearing. Copies will be distributed to Committee Members and will be part of our public record.
